title: 114_s1857
content: The "Microloan Modernization Act of 2015" increases the lending limit for microloan intermediaries from $5,000,000 to $6,000,000 and allows waivers of the 25/75 rule. The Small Business Act is amended to allow waivers of the 25/75 rule for microloan intermediaries. The Administrator will establish a process for intermediaries to apply for and receive a waiver from certain requirements. The Small Business Act is amended to allow waivers of the 25/75 rule for microloan intermediaries. The Administrator will establish a process for intermediaries to apply for and receive a waiver from certain requirements. The applicant must specify how they will use the additional technical assistance. The Small Business Act is amended to allow waivers of the 25/75 rule for microloan intermediaries. Intermediaries must provide assurance of sufficient funds for technical assistance to borrowers. SEC. 5. LINES OF CREDIT AUTHORIZED. Section 7(m)(6)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include lines of credit after short-term. SEC. 6. EXTENDED REPAYMENT TERMS. SEC. 6. EXTENDED REPAYMENT TERMS. The Administrator may not impose limitations on the term for repayment of a loan made by an intermediary to a small business concern or entrepreneur. For loans under $10,000, the repayment term is up to 6 years, and for loans over $10,000, the repayment term is up to 10 years. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct a study on the operations of intermediaries participating in the microloan program and submit a report to the Senate and House Committees on Small Business. The study will focus on reasons for intermediaries not participating in the microloan program, recommendations to increase their participation, and suggestions to reduce costs for eligible intermediaries.
